summary.interpretation: Dual-system athlete: rapid threshold adaptation, slower aerobic base development

endurance_proxy.name: Endurance rides (>2hr, IF 0.6-0.8)
endurance_proxy.interpretation: Aerobic base builds slowly but durably

training_approach: Build aerobic base with high volume over multiple seasons
Threshold work yields quick gains - use strategically pre-event
Don't expect rapid aerobic improvements - stay patient
Win by durability, not speed of adaptation
intensity_management: IF is the dominant driver of next-day feeling (96.6% importance)
Space threshold efforts to allow system recovery
Aerobic rides (IF 0.6-0.8) build base without crushing recovery
taper_strategy: Extended tapers may not help - stay sharp
Threshold fitness responds quickly - can sharpen late
Maintain some intensity during taper periods
Trust the slow aerobic base you've built
periodization: Long base building phases required (months, not weeks)
Threshold blocks can be shorter and more intense
Intensity strategically placed for threshold gains

wko5_export.alternative: Export peak power curve data directly from WKO5
wko5_export.path: File > Export > Power Duration Curve as CSV
